meanings.definition: The internal organ in which the major part of the digestion of food occurs.
meanings.sent1: My stomach growled loudly during the test.
meanings.sent2: She felt a pain in her stomach after eating too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The stomach of the car was filled with gas, making it run smoothly.
meanings.sent4: His hunger was a roaring beast in his stomach, demanding to be fed.
meanings.sent5: The stomach of the ship held the precious cargo safely.

meanings.definition: The front part of the body between the chest and the pelvis.
meanings.sent1: He placed his hand on his stomach to feel the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent2: Her stomach fluttered with excitement before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The stomach of the house, the living room, was cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to rest on her stomach, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The stomach of the mountain, its base, was covered in lush greenery.

meanings.definition: To tolerate or accept something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: I cannot stomach the taste of olives.
meanings.sent2: She had to stomach the criticism from her boss.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stomach the terrible joke, but couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: The news was hard to stomach, but she knew she had to face it.
meanings.sent5: He had to stomach the bitter truth, even though it hurt.
